content.question: A projectile of mass <math alttext="0.2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and an initial velocity of <math alttext="50 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> collides with the end of a blade attached to a turbine. The rotational inertia of the turbine is <math alttext="12.5 kilograms meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><msup><mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assume the loss of energy of the projectile in the collision is completely transferred to the blades, causing them to spin. If the final rebound velocity of the projectile after hitting a turbine blade is <math alttext="negative 25 meter per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is most nearly the rotational velocity of the turbine after the collision?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
